Description

The Trial of Charles I tells the story of Charles I from his surrender in 1646 to his execution in 1649. For such a short span of time, this era was incredibly consequential in the route of British history and the transition in the west to early modern societies.

Players experience this period through ten playable vignettes that give context to the actions of Charles and the regicides.

Players will seek to avoid capture by Parliament as Charles makes his way North, help Colonel Pride perform the only successful coup d'etat in British history and pressure wavering MPs into signing Charles death warrent as Oliver Cromwell.

The Trial of Charles I features multiple primary sources on its historical subject and is heavily influenced by the history of Christopher Hill, who sought to broaden our understanding of the 1600s by framing the events of the century as an "English Revolution".
